name: St. Stanislaus of Krakow

locations.description: Bishop of Krakow, patron saint of Poland

summary: Stanislaus of Krakow was the Bishop of Krakow who was martyred by King Boles≈Çaw II the Bold. He is known for his defense of the poor and his opposition to the king's unjust actions. His martyrdom became a symbol of the Church's independence from secular power in Poland. He is the patron saint of Poland and Krakow, and is one of the most important saints in Polish history.
